text: Glencoe is a city in the U.S. state of Minnesota. It is the county seat of McLeod County. 5,744 people lived here at the 2020 census. == History == Glencoe was planned out in 1855. It is named after Glen Coe in Scotland. A post office has been in operation at Glencoe since 1856. Glencoe was incorporated as a city in 1909. == Geography == The United States Census Bureau says that the city has an area of . Of that is land and is water. U.S. Highway 212 and Minnesota State Highway 22 are two main routes in Glencoe. It is east of Minneapolis. == Population == === 2020 census === The 2020 census says that there were 5,744 people, 2,345 households, and 1,481 families living in Glencoe. The median age was 39.1 years. Of the people, 82.6% were White, 0.5% were Black, 0.4% were Native American, 0.8% were Asian, 5.8% were from some other races, and 9.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 17.1% of the people. == References == == Other websites == * * Glencoe Area Chamber of Commerce and Tourism * Glencoeâ€“Silver Lake Public Schools Category:Cities in Minnesota Category:County seats in Minnesota
title: Glencoe, Minnesota
